snippet: A new report says that only 19 percent of students graduated in four years from most public universities and that only 50 of 580 public universities graduated a majority of their full-time students at the four-year mark.
abstract: Report from nonprofit group Complete College America says only 19 percent of students graduate in four years from most public universities and that only 50 of 580 public universities graduate majority of their full-time students at the four-year mark.
lead_paragraph: A new report says that only 19 percent of students graduated in four years from most public universities and that only 50 of 580 public universities graduated a majority of their full-time students at the four-year mark.

headline.main: Most College Students Don’t Earn a Degree in 4 Years, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Most Don’t Earn Degree in 4 Years, Study Finds
